intro: Linosyris pallida, commonly known as the pale linosyris, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, and it produces small, bristly seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Linosyris pallida is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to tolerate salt spray and arid conditions.
